datafield.subfield: Lords Commissioners of her Majesty's Treasury,
3 vols. : Text - [5], 90 p., 1 double pl., 26 p. diary in Eng. & Arabic. Maps - 5 folded sheets. Photographs - 2 p. contents, 43 p. photographs.
The ordnance survey of Jerusalem was conducted under the direction of Sir Henry James, Director of the Survey. The survey was done mostly by Captain Charles W. Wilson of the Royal Engineers.

Title page reads: 'Ordnance Survey of Jerusalem Made with the Sanction of the Right Hon: Earl de Grey and Ripon, Secretary of State for War, by Captain Charles W. Wilson, R.E. under the direction of Colonel Sir Henry James, R.E. F.R.S. &c. Director of the Ordnance Survey. Published by Authority of the Lords Commissioners of Her Majesty's Treasury.'
The work consists of three parts, bound separately: the text (v.1[46]), the album of maps (v.2[47]) and the album of photographs (v.3[48]).
Jerusalem 1:10,000 (47-1), Haram Grounds, &c. (47-2,47-3), Plan of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre (47-4), [Jerusalem : Floor plans of the Citadel, Dome of the Rock, &c.] (47-5).
Digital version of vol. 1 [Text] on the website of the University of Pennsylvania.
Digital version of vol. 3 [Photographs] on the website of the University of Pennsylvania.
Albright library does not have the map: Jerusalem 1:2,500 1864-5.
